title: Santa Cruz Recreativo Esporte Clube
text:
Santa Cruz Recreativo Esporte Clube, commonly known as Santa Cruz, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> team based in <a href="Santa%20Rita%2C%20Para%C3%ADba">Santa Rita</a>, <a href="Para%C3%ADba">Paraíba state</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> twice.
History.
The club was founded on April 15, 1939. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> in <a href="1994%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1994</a> and in <a href="1995%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1995</a>, being eliminated in the Second Stage in both editions of the competition. Santa Cruz won the <a href="Campeonato%20Paraibano">Campeonato Paraibano</a> in 1995 and in 1996.
Stadium.
Santa Cruz Recreativo Esporte Clube play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Virg%C3%ADnio%20Veloso%20Borges">Estádio Virgínio Veloso Borges</a>, nicknamed "Teixeirão". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 5,000 people.
